TopicTitle: [solved] Infuriating noise in mapview around duna.

Articles.Content:
As the topic says, somewhere around reaching orbit of duna and starting my deorbit burn, this horrific SSTV noise started up, only when I'm in mapview, and I can't turn it off.
I assume this is from one of the mods I have installed (or it's somebody's terrible idea an easter egg), I recall the sound from chatter, but that's not one of them.

I'm putting it here in tech support as this sound is driving me insane, please move it if it belongs elsewhere.
Mod list:

Edited April 4, 2018 by steve_v

Sounds almost as if something made the Duna Pyramid go haywire...

With a mod list like that, you can never be sure. Try removing mods one by one, but DO NOT go into your default save; create a new one. See what fixes it, and, above all, post logs.

And go there^^^

And, just out of curiosity, please try to decode that SSTV signal.

And perhaps post a video of your error.

Edited April 3, 2018 by Mrcarrot

9 minutes ago, Mrcarrot said:

post logs

Here. The errors from Hyperedit can safely be ignored, that was only installed to try and figure out where this is coming from.
FWIW, I suspect I have a rover near the pyramid, but it's been along time so I'm not sure. Happens with other vessels in orbit too though.

20 hours ago, steve_v said:

MapviewMonoSound 1.0.1

And there is the culprit.
CKAN installed the 1.4.x version into my 1.3.1 game, because broken metadata, like every other update.

28 minutes ago, steve_v said:

And there is the culprit.
CKAN installed the 1.4.x version into my 1.3.1 game, because broken metadata, like every other update.

As Hebarusan asked in this thread:

Click the report link and add it to the CKAN 'bug' list.   that way they can fix it.
